The Little House of Lost Play: Mar Vanwa Tyaliéva

wikitext.*:
[[File:59 StJohn Street, Oxford.jpg|250px|thumb]] 
'''59 St John Street''', [[Oxford]], was [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s undergraduate lodgings from [[1914]] to [[1915]] whilst he was studying at the [[University of Oxford]]. There he wrote a [[The Bidding of the Minstrel|poem about Eärendel]] in the winter of 1914<ref>{{LT2|V}}, "[[The Tale of Eärendel]]", p. 269</ref> and months later [[The Little House of Lost Play: Mar Vanwa Tyaliéva|You and Me / and the Cottage of Lost Play|other]] about the [[Cottage of Lost Play]], on [[27 April|27]]-[[28 April]], 1915.<ref>{{LT1|In}}, p. 27</ref>
